I don't know what's getting in teenagers nowadays. It's really sad. And they're from a boarding school, and they're not that stupid to do something like this. If not much, they still have brains! On March 28, a Form Four student of a school in Ampangan was found lying motienless in the dormitory. He was rushed to hospital but was pronounced dead on arrival. The boy has been beated, kicked - causing his death only because of a small things. I really pity his parents. My parents want my lil brother to go to a boarding school since he is so lazy and get bad results. But I don't want him to go there since I don't really trust boarding school after many cases of gangsterisme that happened in boarding school. I don't want my brother to be the next Farid. A kettle is the price of his life. Okay... the eight boys don't wish to kill him, I can accept that. But they shouldn't do that to their junior... it's so cruel!! However I do pity them, growing up with this memory of killing someone is sure hurtful. If a real murder, they won't feel anything. But it's not the same with this eight boys. They kicked and beated Farid without a wish of killing him... but ... he.. d.i.e.d. They never wished to be a killer but now they ARE killers. And they can't do anything about it now that he's dead. Before doing something, try to think of the consequences. Their age saved them however. Here is the stinging words from the judge for the students. "ikut nafsu,lesu;ikut rasa binasa (english- u reap what u sow), In Islam, at this age, u are considered an akil baligh(adults) who know the do's and the don'ts. However on the civil law, u're still underaged, and therefore u can't be sentenced to death. Your age has saved u and u are very fortunate. Think about what u've done and repent. Hopefully, this will serve as a lesson to all of u." The eight boys who had just been convicted of murder were being led to the police lock-up when their paths crossed with Farid's father. A few of them looked at him and said, " we're sorry, uncle". He could only offer a stony stare. He loves his son very much. They are like friends and very fond of each other... so we can imagine how is his feeling losing someone he loves. I hope that this will not serve a lesson only to the students involved but also to other students outside there so they won't be doing the same things. I hope this will not happen again. On a side note, I'm feeling better now. I love u panadols.. muah.. thankie
